title: Christian Science
summary: Christian Science is a set of beliefs and practices belonging to the metaphysical family of new religious movements.[n 2] It was founded in 19th-century New England by Mary Baker Eddy, who argued in her 1875 book Science and Health with Key to the Scriptures that sickness is an illusion that can be corrected by prayer alone.[n 3] The book became Christian Science's central text, along with the Bible, and by 2001 had sold over nine million copies.[5]
